acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Ralph E. McCoy Collection was donated to Special Collections in 2001.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Ralph E. McCoy Collection was completed in September 2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Ralph Edward McCoy was born on October 1, 1915 in St. Louis, Missouri. He married Melba McKibben in 1940, and they had two sons named Robert Allan McCoy and David Lawrence McCoy. He received an undergraduate degree from Illinois Wesleyan University in 1937, and a library degree in 1939 and a Ph.D. degree in 1956 from the University of Illinois. From 1943-1946, he served in the US Army. From 1955-1956, he was the Dean of Libraries at Southern Illinois University. In 1995, he and his wife moved to Blacksburg, Virginia. He died in September 2007.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Ralph E. McCoy Collection contains materials collected by McCoy: publications, correspondence, programs, and Civil War memorabilia. The collection includes a variety of materials including membership cards and honors received, event invitations and programs, Civil War publications and photographs, newsletters from different organizations, and World War II ration coupons.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Ralph E. McCoy Collection is arranged in folders by material type. Folders are arranged alphabetically by title.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Three VHS tapes were removed from the collection and cataloged for the Special Collections media materials: "Grant's Tomb Centennial," "Life of Abraham Lincoln," and "U.S. Grant Association C-Span Broadcast."
